abstract: Some former iPhone owners, tired of the AT&T network and Apple’s walled garden, are trying out Google’s Android platform.
snippet: Some former iPhone owners, tired of the AT&T network and Apple’s walled garden, are trying out Google’s Android platform.
lead_paragraph: I’ve seen it a thousand times: Sit down for coffee or a meeting and those in attendance automatically reach for their cellphones and place them on the table. It’s almost like a subconscious signal that says ‘I’ll be sitting here for a while.’
